00046 void setup(){
00047

00049   //Serial.println("CONTROLLER ON!");

00060 void loop(){
00061 
00062   int sendInstruction = 0;
00063   byte debug =0;
00064   instruction instrRCV;
00065 
00066   sonars.readRanges();
00067   //  int x = sonars.getRange(front);
00068   //  int y = sonars.getRange(right);
00069   int x = analogRead(front);
00070   int y = analogRead(right);
00071 
00072   //processSerial0Bus();
00073   //debugSerial();
00074 
00075  if ( wirelessBus.readIncoming() == 1) //we received an instruction
00076     iQ.push( *wirelessBus.getInstr() ); //store instruction into memory
00077   
00078 
00079   /*the following is debug code */
00080   if (iQ.size() >0){ 
00081     instrRCV = iQ.pop(); //we can use a function to check whether we should process the instruction or not. ie: pc instr instead of wiinunchuk
00082     //sendInstruction = 1;     //this should be moved to the transator functions
00083     sendToI2C(instrRCV.aid);
00084     for(int j =0; j<varSize; j++){ 
00085       var[j] = (int)random(0,6500);
00086     }
00087 
00088     var[0] = instrRCV.pcid;
00089     var[1] = instrRCV.aid;
00090     var[2] = instrRCV.data;
00091     //Serial.println(var[0]);
00092     //Serial.println(var[1]);
00093     //Serial.println(var[2]);
00094     wirelessBus.sendTelemetry(var,varSize);
00095   }
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 }

00107 void initI2C(){
00108 
00109   Wire.begin( HLCADDR);
00110   Wire.onReceive(receiveEvent);
00111 }
00112 
00113 void sendToI2C(byte instr){ 
00114   Wire.beginTransmission(LLCADDR);
00115   //Wire.send(state);
00116   Wire.send(instr); 
00117   Wire.endTransmission();
00118 }
00119
